CatDescriptText: Mr. James Robinson, 1927 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 31, 1958, pg. A1 question reads: "Do you think people follow political leadership more than religious leadership? Why?" answer reads: "The minister, and the reason is that the people look to him first.  For instance, in politics, the first thing that they investigate about the candidate is his church affiliation."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Robinson, wearing dark cap, striped pullover shirt, and dark cardigan, standing on Liberty Avenue with Mellon Bank in background, Downtown
